Title: Relates to expanding criminal mischief in the third degree to include damaging property of another as an expression of political ideology
Summary: Provides that a person is guilty of criminal mischief in the third degree when such person intentionally damages property of another person to promote or suppress a political ideology, or otherwise as an expression of political ideology.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to criminal mischief in the third degree
